      • supportsFile

        public boolean supportsFile(File file)
        Description copied from interface: LocalPluginBase
        This method will be called for every file that matches the given extensions. It is an opportunity for the plugin to perform arbitrarily complex acceptance filtering on a per file basis, but it is important to understand performance implications if the acceptance test is too intensive and the directory of files to recurse is large.
        Specified by:
        supportsFile in interface LocalPluginBase
        Parameters:
        file - The file to determine if this plugin supports for ingestion
        Returns:
        Whether the file is supported or not

      • getSupportedIndices

        public Index[] getSupportedIndices()
        Description copied from interface: LocalFileIngestPlugin
        Get an array of indices that are supported by this ingestion implementation. This should be the full set of possible indices to use for this ingest type (for example both spatial and spatial-temporal, or perhaps just one).
        Specified by:

      • getDataAdapters

        public WritableDataAdapter<org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature>[] getDataAdapters(String globalVisibility)
        Description copied from interface: DataAdapterProvider
        Get all writable adapters used by this plugin
        Specified by:
        getDataAdapters in interface DataAdapterProvider<org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature>
        Parameters:
        globalVisibility - If on the command-line the user specifies a global visibility to write to the visibility column in GeoWave, it is passed along here. It is assumed that this is the same visibility string that will be passed to IngestPluginBase.toGeoWaveData()

        An array of adapters that may be used by this plugin

      • toGeoWaveData

        public CloseableIterator<GeoWaveData<org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature>> toGeoWaveData(File input,
                                                                                     ByteArrayId primaryIndexId,
                                                                                     String globalVisibility)
        Description copied from interface: IngestPluginBase
        Convert from an expected input format to a data format that can be directly ingested into GeoWave
        Specified by:
        toGeoWaveData in interface IngestPluginBase<File,org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature>
        Parameters:
        input - The expected input.
        primaryIndexId - The index ID specified via a commandline argument (this is typically either the default spatial index or default spatial-temporal index)
        globalVisibility - If on the command-line the user specifies a global visibility to write to the visibility column in GeoWave, it is passed along here. It is assumed that this is the same visibility string that will be passed to DataAdapterProvider.getDataAdapters()
        Returns:
        The objects that can be directly ingested into GeoWave

      • isUseReducerPreferred

        public boolean isUseReducerPreferred()
        Description copied from interface: IngestFromHdfsPlugin
        Returns a flag indicating to the ingestion framework whether it should try to use the ingestWithMapper() implementation or the ingestWithReducer() implementation in the case that both implementations are non-null.
        Specified by:
        isUseReducerPreferred in interface IngestFromHdfsPlugin<TdrivePoint,org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature>
        Returns:
        If true, the framework will use ingestWithReducer() and only fall back to ingestWithMapper() if necessary, otherwise the behavior will be the reverse

      • ingestWithMapper

        public IngestWithMapper<TdrivePoint,org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature> ingestWithMapper()
        Description copied from interface: IngestFromHdfsPlugin
        An implementation of ingestion that can be persisted to a mapper within the map-reduce job configuration to perform an ingest of data into GeoWave from intermediate data
        Specified by:
        ingestWithMapper in interface IngestFromHdfsPlugin<TdrivePoint,org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature>
        Returns:
        The implementation for ingestion with only a mapper

      • ingestWithReducer

        public IngestWithReducer<TdrivePoint,?,?,org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature> ingestWithReducer()
        Description copied from interface: IngestFromHdfsPlugin
        An implementation of ingestion that can be persisted to a mapper and reducer within the map-reduce job configuration to aggregate intermediate data by defined keys within a reducer and perform an ingest of data into GeoWave from the key-value pairs emitted by the mapper.
        Specified by:
        ingestWithReducer in interface IngestFromHdfsPlugin<TdrivePoint,org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature>
        Returns:
        The implementation for ingestion with a mapper and reducer. It is important to provide the correct concrete implementation of Key and Value classes within the appropriate generics because the framework will use reflection to set the key and value classes for map-reduce.

      • getRequiredIndices

        public Index[] getRequiredIndices()
        Description copied from interface: IngestFromHdfsPlugin
        Get an array of indices that are required by this ingestion implementation. This should be a subset of supported indices. All of these indices will automatically be persisted with GeoWave's metadata store and in the job configuration, whereas indices that are just "supported" will not automatically be persisted (only if they are the primary index). This is primarily useful if there is a supplemental index required by the ingestion process that is not the primary index.
        Specified by:
        getRequiredIndices in interface IngestFromHdfsPlugin<TdrivePoint,org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature>
        Returns:
        the array of indices that are supported by this ingestion implementation
